comments.text:

comments.author: William Brennan

comments.text:

don't care about the lie because you are laughing.
comments.author: The Rook

comments.text: He only "lies" when it's obvious he's lying.
comments.author: William Brennan

comments.text:
+William Brennan Comedy intentionally distorts or withholds information in 
order to create humor.  In other words, comedy uses ad hominem attacks, 
strawman arguments and appeals to ridicule in order to make people laugh. 
 None of that is bad until you use it to promote a particular ideology, 
which is exactly what Stewart does.  He basically lies to convince you of 
his beliefs.

For example, in a recent piece about Brian Williams, Stewart makes the 
snide comment, "“Finally, someone is being held to account for misleading 
America about the Iraq war."  Now, any fair-minded person knows that there 
are two sides to the misinformation that led to the Iraq War.

http://www.reasons-for-war-with-iraq.info/

However, with this little jibe, Stewart condenses what are reams and reams 
of nuance into the "Bush lied, Men died," meme.
comments.author: The Rook

comments.text: What is dishonest about using comedy?
comments.author: William Brennan

comments.text:
+William Brennan Really?  Those who promote an ideology honestly, I have no 
truck with.  But fucking bitches like Stewart who use comedy to promote 
ideology are, by definition, dishonest people.  So, excuse his dishonesty 
if you like.  You still cannot deny his persuasive style is based on lies.
comments.author: The Rook

comments.text:
Everyone on TV spends all their time promoting either their own ideology, 
or the ideology they're paid to espouse. There is nothing unique about

comments.author: Andrew Palim

comments.text:
Here is the thing, the reason that these people continually get elected is 
that people who like these guys are the ones who are actually voting in 
elections.  I am a proud liberal, and I am ashamed to say I did not vote in 
midterm elections until last fall at the age of 25, I should have done it 
sooner, but I am hardly the only one to make that mistake.  Our votes 
matter, and by not voting we share a piece of the blame for allowing people 
like this to take control of Congress last fall, and we as a community 
share a piece of the blame for allowing these people to dominate our 
government for much of our history as a Nation.  

Political surveys throughout the country demonstrate that most Americans do 
not agree with the people shown in the video above, but surveys mean 
nothing.  The right wing hacks who DO agree with them are the ones who vote 
them into the office with strong resolve, fund raise for them, show up to 
city hall meetings, picket on the street, and raise all hell if they don't 
get their way.  DECISIONS ARE MADE BY THOSE WHO SHOW UP, AND THEY SHOW UP 
MORE THAN WE DO.  They don't play nice either, they bash "Liberals" so much 
that they have turned it into a dirty word, and Liberals caved at one point 
by trying to change their label to "Progressives", which was a profound act 
of cowardice in my opinion.  We cave in such ways quite often in fact.

We should be labeling Tea Party Republicans and FOX News analysts for what 
they are.  Bigoted, Xenophobic, Willfully Uniformed, Dishonest hacks who 
view anything that goes against their ideology as the enemy and must be 
verbally attacked with no regard for factual evidence.  We need to take off 
the kids gloves and get in the fight, and we need to respect that power 
that we all have only if we do so together as a larger community.  Let us 
become aware of these issues, let us rally among those who agree, let us 
debate with those who respectfully disagree and let us vehemently oppose 
those who disrespectfully disagree.  

But more than anything else, just vote people.  ﻿

but I would look deeper into it if he was a candidate.

comments.text:
+Tera Nelson Don't get me wrong, Ron Paul had some very scary ideas. That's 
why I never voted for him. But Rand Paul takes all the good issues from his 
father, and very few of the bad. Everybody has viewpoints that can be 
considered bad to others, the point being that you have to the candidate 
that has the least bad ideas. Rand Paul is that candidate. And before you 
dog on Paul, please go learn what his REAL policies are. Find an unbiased 
news source. And by unbiased, I don't mean FOX, NBC, or CNN.
